Description: Complete pottery unguentarium vessel with black painted rim. Pink-orange fabric with salmon-red core some very fine quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes Parallels from Late 1st century BC to early 1st century AD (Hayes 1976, nos 157, 343, 336). Greek Hellenistic, 3rd to 1st century BC, parallels now in the British Museum such as GR 1964,0408.14. from Chauchitza, Greece, and three examples from the Townley collection (1814,0704.662, 1814,0704.1111 and particularly 1814,0704.669). Found in various grave groups, commonly dated from the mid 3rd century BC in Cyprus (Report of the Department of Antiquites of Cyprus1990). 1st century BC and later parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Enklaar 1998, 23, fig.20). Enklaar, A. 1998. Preliminary report on the pottery found at Hadra station, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 15-24.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.131)
